metadata.title: рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп (Gopal's Bravery)
metadata.subject: Marathi
metadata.description: An inspiring story by Lakshmikamala Gedam (born 1956) about a 14-year-old student named Gopal who shows extraordinary bravery during a school picnic to Karnagad fort near Mohdi village, Nagpur. On the way back, the students encounter a dangerous wildfire (рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛). When adults are helpless, Gopal jumps out of the bus, uses a rubber irrigation pipe to fight the fire, calls the fire brigade (101), and saves herders and animals. The chapter also revises Marathi parts of speech: noun (рдирд╛рдо), pronoun (рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо), adjective (рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг), and verb (рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж).

preAssessment.question: Who is the author of the story 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп' (Gopal's Bravery)?
What is the Marathi word for 'wildfire' or 'forest fire'?
What emergency number should you call for the Fire Brigade in India?
What did Gopal use to fight the wildfire?

options.C: A rubber irrigation pipe from a nearby field
options.D: A fire extinguisher from the bus

concepts.title: About the Author and Story Setting
concepts.content: Lakshmikamala Gedam (born 1956) is a Marathi writer from Vidarbha region, known for writing stories that inspire children with values of bravery, social responsibility, and compassion. The story is set in the Nagpur area of Maharashtra. A school takes students on a picnic to Karnagad fort, located near Mohdi village in Nagpur district. Karnagad is a historical hill fort тАФ visiting such forts is a popular educational activity in Maharashtra. The story begins with the excitement of a school picnic but quickly turns into a test of courage when the students witness a dangerous wildfire on their way back.

examples.text: School picnics to historical forts are common in Maharashtra тАФ students learn history while enjoying nature.
Nagpur is in Vidarbha region тАФ famous for oranges, tigers (Tadoba National Park), and historical forts.
Lakshmikamala Gedam writes stories that inspire children with real-world courage and moral values.
Karnagad fort near Mohdi village is the picnic destination тАФ historical Maharashtra forts are educational treasures.

keyPoints: Lakshmikamala Gedam is a Marathi writer born in 1956, known for inspiring children's stories.
The story is set in Nagpur, Vidarbha region тАФ an area known for forests and historical forts.
School picnics to historical forts (рдХрд┐рд▓реНрд▓реЗ) are an important educational tradition in Maharashtra.
The story starts as a happy picnic trip but turns into a bravery test when wildfire appears.
The story is based on realistic scenarios тАФ wildfires (рд╡рдгрд╡реЗ) are a real danger in Maharashtra's forests.
concepts.funFact: Maharashtra has hundreds of historical forts (рдХрд┐рд▓реНрд▓реЗ) тАФ over 350 forts built by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and the Maratha Empire! School trips to forts like Raigad, Sinhagad, Rajgad, and Pratapgad are very popular across the state.
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 4, Pages 7-14 тАФ Maharashtra Board 7th Grade Marathi (Second Language)

concepts.title: Gopal's Brave Action тАФ Fighting the Wildfire
concepts.content: On the return journey from the Karnagad fort picnic, the students see a wildfire (рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛) тАФ a fast-spreading forest fire. The bus driver speeds up to escape, and the teachers feel helpless. But 14-year-old Gopal does not panic. He makes a quick decision: he jumps out of the moving bus! He spots an irrigation rubber pipe in a nearby field, drags it out, and uses it to direct water onto the fire. Seeing Gopal act, other students and adults are inspired to join him. Gopal also calls 101 (Fire Brigade). Two fire engines arrive within 20 minutes. Together, they extinguish the fire and save herders (goatherds and cowherds) and their animals who were trapped nearby.

examples.text: Gopal jumps from the school bus тАФ he doesn't wait for permission, he acts immediately when lives are at risk.
He finds a rubber irrigation pipe in a nearby farm тАФ quick thinking and awareness of his surroundings.
He calls 101 тАФ the fire brigade number in India тАФ showing knowledge of emergency services.
His action saves herders and their animals тАФ proving that bravery helps both humans and animals.

keyPoints: Gopal was 14 years old тАФ showing that young people can show extraordinary courage and leadership.
рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛ = wildfire/forest fire тАФ spreads rapidly in dry conditions, extremely dangerous.
Gopal used available resources smartly: rubber pipe from a nearby field + called 101.
His action inspired others to join тАФ true leadership motivates others through example.
Gopal's famous quote: 'Whether humans or animals, we must save them!' (рдорд╛рдгреВрд╕ рдЕрд╕реЛ рд╡рд╛ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгреА, рдЖрдкрдг рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗрдЪ рдкрд╛рд╣рд┐рдЬреЗ!)
concepts.funFact: Forest fires are a serious problem in India тАФ every year, thousands of hectares of forest are destroyed by wildfires, especially in summer (MarchтАУJune). Maharashtra's forests (including around Nagpur, Chandrapur, and Gadchiroli) are vulnerable to рд╡рдгрд╡реЗ. Forest Department volunteers and local youth play a vital role in controlling them.
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 4, Pages 8-13 тАФ Gopal's brave action

concepts.title: Fire Brigade and Teamwork
concepts.content: The Fire Brigade is called 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓' (Agnishaman Dal) in Marathi. 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐' means fire and 'рд╢рдорди' means to extinguish/calm. The emergency number for Fire Brigade in India is 101. In the story, Gopal calls 101 and two fire engines arrive within 20 minutes. This shows the importance of: (1) knowing emergency numbers, (2) calling for professional help even while you take initial action, and (3) teamwork тАФ the students, Gopal, and the fire brigade all worked together. The story teaches that bravery is not just physical courage but also having the presence of mind to use resources effectively.

examples.text: Emergency number 101 (Fire Brigade) тАФ every student should memorize this. Police: 100, Ambulance: 108, Emergency: 112.
Two fire engines arrived in 20 minutes тАФ professional help is powerful when called promptly.
Teamwork: Gopal + students + fire brigade together fought the fire more effectively than anyone alone.
'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓' = Fire Brigade тАФ рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐ (fire) + рд╢рдорди (extinguishing) + рджрд▓ (force/group).

keyPoints: 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓' is the Marathi name for Fire Brigade тАФ learn this word and the emergency number 101.
Emergency numbers in India: 100 (Police), 101 (Fire Brigade), 108 (Ambulance), 112 (All emergencies).
Calling professionals quickly is as important as taking immediate action yourself.
Teamwork multiplies the effect of individual bravery тАФ Gopal's action inspired others to join.
The fire was extinguished and herders were saved тАФ teamwork produced a successful outcome.
concepts.funFact: India's unified emergency number is 112, similar to 911 in the US or 999 in the UK. When you call 112, you are connected to police, fire brigade, or ambulance тАФ whichever you need. This number works across India on all mobile networks, even without a SIM balance!
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 4, Pages 12-14 тАФ Fire brigade and teamwork

concepts.title: Forest Fire тАФ Causes and Prevention
concepts.content: A wildfire (рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛) is an uncontrolled fire that spreads rapidly through forests, grasslands, or bushland. In Maharashtra, forest fires are most common in the summer months (MarchтАУJune) when forests are dry and hot winds blow. Main causes: (1) Someone carelessly throwing a lit cigarette or bidi (burning stub); (2) Burning of dry grass in fields; (3) Lightning strikes in dry areas; (4) Deliberate burning for land clearing. Prevention: Never throw burning items in or near forests; do not light fires in dry areas; report smoke or fire immediately by calling 101 or 112; inform the Forest Department. The story teaches students to be responsible citizens who take action when they see a danger.

examples.text: A carelessly thrown burning bidi (cheap cigarette) in dry grass can start a wildfire within minutes.
Hot, dry summer winds in Maharashtra (especially loo winds in Vidarbha) make forests extremely vulnerable to fire.
If you see forest fire or smoke: call 101 or 112 immediately тАФ quick reporting saves forests and lives.
Forests provide oxygen, rain, wildlife habitat, and prevent soil erosion тАФ every tree saved matters.

keyPoints: рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛ = wildfire/forest fire тАФ uncontrolled and extremely dangerous.
Main causes: careless burning, discarded burning items, land clearing, lightning in dry weather.
Forest fires are worst in Maharashtra's Vidarbha region (Chandrapur, Gadchiroli) in summer months.
Prevention: never throw burning items in forests, never light fires in dry areas, report fires immediately.
Emergency: Call 101 (Fire Brigade) or 112 тАФ be a responsible citizen like Gopal.
concepts.funFact: The forests of Chandrapur, Maharashtra, are home to tigers, leopards, and elephants. Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve (near Nagpur/Chandrapur) is one of India's best tiger reserves. Protecting these forests from рд╡рдгрд╡реЗ (wildfires) is critical for Maharashtra's wildlife!
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 4, Pages 7-14 тАФ Forest fire education

concepts.title: Grammar Review: Parts of Speech (рдирд╛рдо, рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо, рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг, рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж)
concepts.content: This chapter revises the four main parts of speech in Marathi: (1) рдирд╛рдо (Naam) = Noun тАФ the name of a person, place, thing, or idea; e.g., рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│, рд╢рд╛рд│рд╛, рдЖрдЧ. (2) рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо (Sarvanam) = Pronoun тАФ a word used INSTEAD of a noun to avoid repetition; e.g., рддреЛ (he), рддреА (she), рддреЗ (they), рдореА (I), рддреБрдореНрд╣реА (you). (3) рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг (Visheshan) = Adjective тАФ a word that describes a noun; e.g., рд╢реВрд░ (brave), рдореЛрдард╛ (big), рд▓рд╛рд▓ (red). (4) рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж (Kriyapad) = Verb тАФ a word that shows action or state of being; e.g., рдЙрдбреА рдорд╛рд░рд▓реА (jumped), рдкрд│рд╛рд▓рд╛ (ran), рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ (saved).

examples.text: рдирд╛рдо (Noun): 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│ рдЙрдбреА рдорд╛рд░рд▓реА' тАФ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│ is the noun (person's name).
рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо (Pronoun): Instead of repeating 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│', we say 'рддреЛ' (he) тАФ 'рддреЛ рдЦреВрдк рд╢реВрд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ.'
рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг (Adjective): 'рд╢реВрд░ рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛' тАФ рд╢реВрд░ (brave) describes the noun рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛ (boy).
рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж (Verb): 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдиреЗ рдЖрдЧ рд╡рд┐рдЭрд╡рд▓реА' тАФ рд╡рд┐рдЭрд╡рд▓реА (extinguished) is the verb showing the action.

keyPoints: рдирд╛рдо (Noun): names of people, places, things, feelings тАФ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│, рд╢рд╛рд│рд╛, рдЖрдЧ, рдкреНрд░реЗрдо.
рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо (Pronoun): replaces nouns тАФ рдореА, рддреВ, рддреЛ, рддреА, рддреЗ, рдЖрдореНрд╣реА, рддреБрдореНрд╣реА, рддреЗ.
рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг (Adjective): describes nouns тАФ рд╢реВрд░ (brave), рдореЛрдард╛ (big), рд▓рд╛рд▓ (red), рд╕реБрдВрджрд░ (beautiful).
рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж (Verb): shows action or state тАФ рдЪрд╛рд▓рдгреЗ (walk), рдЦрд╛рдгреЗ (eat), рдЕрд╕рдгреЗ (to be), рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рдгреЗ (save).
Every sentence has at least a noun and a verb; adjectives and pronouns make speech richer and less repetitive.
concepts.funFact: Marathi has an interesting feature: verbs change their ending based on the GENDER of the subject! For example, 'Gopal jumped' = 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдиреЗ рдЙрдбреА рдорд╛рд░рд▓реА' but 'Meena jumped' = 'рдореАрдирд╛рдиреЗ рдЙрдбреА рдорд╛рд░рд▓реА' тАФ the verb stays the same here, but in many tenses, the verb ending changes to match the subject's gender. This is called verb agreement (рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛-рдХрд╛рд░рдХ рд╕рд╛рдордВрдЬрд╕реНрдп)!
concepts.textbookRef: Chapter 4, Pages 7-14 тАФ Grammar: Parts of Speech

test.question: Where was the school picnic going in the story 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп'?

options.B: Karnagad Fort near Mohdi village, Nagpur

test.explanation: The school picnic was to Karnagad fort near Mohdi village in the Nagpur district. Visiting historical forts is a popular educational activity in Maharashtra. The wildfire occurred on the return journey from this picnic.

test.question: What was the Marathi word for 'wildfire/forest fire' as used in the story?
test.explanation: 'рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛' is the Marathi word for a wildfire or forest fire тАФ an uncontrolled fire spreading through dry vegetation. 'рджреАрдкрдХ' means lamp, 'рдЙрдЬреЗрдб' means light, and 'рдореЗрдгрдмрддреНрддреА' means candle. Recognizing this word is important for understanding the story.

test.question: What is the Marathi name for the Fire Brigade?
test.explanation: 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓' is the Marathi name for the Fire Brigade. 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐' = fire, 'рд╢рдорди' = extinguishing/calming, 'рджрд▓' = force/group. So 'fire-extinguishing force.' 'рдкреЛрд▓реАрд╕ рджрд▓' = police force, 'рд╡реИрджреНрдпрдХреАрдп рджрд▓' = medical team.

test.question: What is the fire brigade emergency number in India?
test.explanation: The Fire Brigade (рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓) emergency number in India is 101. Other important numbers: 100 = Police, 108 = Ambulance, 102 = Women's helpline, 112 = All-in-one emergency number. Gopal called 101 in the story, and two fire engines arrived within 20 minutes.

test.question: In Marathi grammar, what is a 'рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо' (Sarvanam)?

options.A: A word that names a person or place (noun)
options.B: A word that describes a noun (adjective)
options.C: A word used in place of a noun to avoid repetition (pronoun)

test.explanation: рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо (pronoun) is a word used INSTEAD of a noun to avoid repeating it. For example, instead of saying 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдиреЗ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреА рдмрд╕ рд╕реЛрдбрд▓реА' (Gopal left Gopal's bus), we use 'рддреЛ' (he): 'рддреЛ рдмрд╕рдордзреВрди рдЙрддрд░рд▓рд╛' (He got off the bus). Common Marathi pronouns: рдореА (I), рддреВ (you), рддреЛ (he), рддреА (she), рддреЗ (they).

test.question: Identify the adjective (рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг) in this sentence: 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│ рдПрдХ рд╢реВрд░ рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛ рдЖрд╣реЗ.' (Gopal is a brave boy.)
test.explanation: 'рд╢реВрд░' means 'brave' and it describes the noun 'рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛' (boy) тАФ it tells us WHAT KIND of boy Gopal is. This is an adjective (рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг). 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│' is a noun (proper name), 'рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛' is a noun, and 'рдЖрд╣реЗ' is a verb (to be).

test.question: What did Gopal say when people praised him for his bravery?

options.A: I did it to be famous
options.B: Whether humans or animals, we must save them!
options.C: I was just doing what the teacher told me
options.D: It was easy тАФ anyone could have done it

test.explanation: Gopal's famous words were: 'рдорд╛рдгреВрд╕ рдЕрд╕реЛ рд╡рд╛ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгреА, рдЖрдкрдг рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗрдЪ рдкрд╛рд╣рд┐рдЬреЗ!' тАФ 'Whether humans or animals, we must save them!' This quote shows his belief in equal compassion for all living beings, and his sense of moral responsibility regardless of species.

test.question: How long did it take for fire engines to arrive after Gopal called 101?
test.explanation: Two fire engines arrived approximately 20 minutes after Gopal called 101. This shows the importance of calling emergency services immediately тАФ prompt calling led to rapid response. The story uses this realistic detail to teach students about the effectiveness of emergency services when used properly.

test.question: Which of these is a verb (рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж) in Marathi?
test.explanation: 'рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ' means 'saved' тАФ it is an action word (verb/рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж). 'рд╢рд╛рд│рд╛' is a noun (place), 'рдореЛрдард╛' is an adjective (describing size), and 'рддреЛ' is a pronoun (replacing a noun). In the story, 'Gopal рдиреЗ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ' тАФ Gopal saved everyone. 'рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ' is the рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж.

test.question: What is the main moral/message of the story 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп'?

options.A: Children should never leave their school bus
options.B: Forest fires should only be handled by professionals
options.C: Quick thinking, bravery, and taking responsibility can save lives regardless of age
options.D: School picnics should be cancelled for safety

test.explanation: The story's central message is that true bravery (рд╢реМрд░реНрдп) means taking responsibility and acting with courage and quick thinking, regardless of age. A 14-year-old Gopal showed that young people can make a real difference. His actions тАФ jumping out, finding resources, calling 101, inspiring others тАФ all show smart, brave, responsible behavior.

keyConcepts: рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп тАФ story of 14-year-old Gopal fighting a wildfire
Karnagad fort, Nagpur тАФ picnic location
Parts of speech: рдирд╛рдо (noun), рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо (pronoun), рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг (adjective), рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж (verb)
Gopal's quote: рдорд╛рдгреВрд╕ рдЕрд╕реЛ рд╡рд╛ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгреА, рдЖрдкрдг рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗрдЪ рдкрд╛рд╣рд┐рдЬреЗ
commonMisconceptions: Students may confuse рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг (adjective - describes noun) with рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг (adverb - describes verb).
The emergency number 101 is sometimes confused with 100 (police) тАФ 101 is specifically fire brigade.
Students may think рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо only refers to 'he/she/it' тАФ but it includes рдореА (I), рддреВ (you), рдЖрдореНрд╣реА (we) as well.
Some students may think рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛ only refers to forest fires тАФ it can refer to any spreading wildfire including in fields and grasslands.
realWorldExamples: Maharashtra forts: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj built over 300 forts тАФ Raigad, Sinhagad, Rajgad are popular school trip destinations.
Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve near Chandrapur/Nagpur тАФ forest fires are a serious threat to this tiger habitat.
Real student bravery: India has a National Bravery Award (Indira Gandhi Priyadarshini Balveer Award) given annually to children who show extraordinary courage.
Fire Brigade training: Many Maharashtra municipalities offer fire safety demonstrations in schools тАФ students can learn to use fire extinguishers.

interactiveElement.title: Unscramble the Word!
interactiveElement.description: Rearrange the letters to form the correct Marathi vocabulary word.

textbookExercise.instructions: Memorize these exam-style answers to maximize scoring in textbook-focused assessments.

qaCards.question: Where was the school picnic going in the story 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп'?
qaCards.answer: The school picnic was to Karnagad fort near Mohdi village in the Nagpur district. Visiting historical forts is a popular educational activity in Maharashtra. The wildfire occurred on the return journey from this picnic.

qaCards.question: What was the Marathi word for 'wildfire/forest fire' as used in the story?
qaCards.answer: 'рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛' is the Marathi word for a wildfire or forest fire тАФ an uncontrolled fire spreading through dry vegetation. 'рджреАрдкрдХ' means lamp, 'рдЙрдЬреЗрдб' means light, and 'рдореЗрдгрдмрддреНрддреА' means candle. Recognizing this word is important for understanding the story.

qaCards.question: What is the Marathi name for the Fire Brigade?
qaCards.answer: 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓' is the Marathi name for the Fire Brigade. 'рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐' = fire, 'рд╢рдорди' = extinguishing/calming, 'рджрд▓' = force/group. So 'fire-extinguishing force.' 'рдкреЛрд▓реАрд╕ рджрд▓' = police force, 'рд╡реИрджреНрдпрдХреАрдп рджрд▓' = medical team.

qaCards.question: What is the fire brigade emergency number in India?
qaCards.answer: The Fire Brigade (рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рд╢рдорди рджрд▓) emergency number in India is 101. Other important numbers: 100 = Police, 108 = Ambulance, 102 = Women's helpline, 112 = All-in-one emergency number. Gopal called 101 in the story, and two fire engines arrived within 20 minutes.

qaCards.question: In Marathi grammar, what is a 'рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо' (Sarvanam)?
qaCards.answer: рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдирд╛рдо (pronoun) is a word used INSTEAD of a noun to avoid repeating it. For example, instead of saying 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдиреЗ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреА рдмрд╕ рд╕реЛрдбрд▓реА' (Gopal left Gopal's bus), we use 'рддреЛ' (he): 'рддреЛ рдмрд╕рдордзреВрди рдЙрддрд░рд▓рд╛' (He got off the bus). Common Marathi pronouns: рдореА (I), рддреВ (you), рддреЛ (he), рддреА (she), рддреЗ (they).

qaCards.question: Identify the adjective (рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг) in this sentence: 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│ рдПрдХ рд╢реВрд░ рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛ рдЖрд╣реЗ.' (Gopal is a brave boy.)
qaCards.answer: 'рд╢реВрд░' means 'brave' and it describes the noun 'рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛' (boy) тАФ it tells us WHAT KIND of boy Gopal is. This is an adjective (рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рдг). 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│' is a noun (proper name), 'рдореБрд▓рдЧрд╛' is a noun, and 'рдЖрд╣реЗ' is a verb (to be).

qaCards.question: What did Gopal say when people praised him for his bravery?
qaCards.answer: Gopal's famous words were: 'рдорд╛рдгреВрд╕ рдЕрд╕реЛ рд╡рд╛ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгреА, рдЖрдкрдг рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗрдЪ рдкрд╛рд╣рд┐рдЬреЗ!' тАФ 'Whether humans or animals, we must save them!' This quote shows his belief in equal compassion for all living beings, and his sense of moral responsibility regardless of species.

qaCards.question: How long did it take for fire engines to arrive after Gopal called 101?
qaCards.answer: Two fire engines arrived approximately 20 minutes after Gopal called 101. This shows the importance of calling emergency services immediately тАФ prompt calling led to rapid response. The story uses this realistic detail to teach students about the effectiveness of emergency services when used properly.

qaCards.question: Which of these is a verb (рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж) in Marathi?
qaCards.answer: 'рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ' means 'saved' тАФ it is an action word (verb/рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж). 'рд╢рд╛рд│рд╛' is a noun (place), 'рдореЛрдард╛' is an adjective (describing size), and 'рддреЛ' is a pronoun (replacing a noun). In the story, 'Gopal рдиреЗ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ' тАФ Gopal saved everyone. 'рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓реЗ' is the рдХреНрд░рд┐рдпрд╛рдкрдж.

qaCards.question: What is the main moral/message of the story 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп'?
qaCards.answer: The story's central message is that true bravery (рд╢реМрд░реНрдп) means taking responsibility and acting with courage and quick thinking, regardless of age. A 14-year-old Gopal showed that young people can make a real difference. His actions тАФ jumping out, finding resources, calling 101, inspiring others тАФ all show smart, brave, responsible behavior.

longAnswers.question: рдХрд░реНрдгрд╛рдЧрдб рдХреБрдареЗ рд╡рд╕рд▓реЗрд▓рд╛ рдЖрд╣реЗ?
longAnswers.modelAnswer: рдХрд░реНрдгрд╛рдЧрдб рд╣рд╛ рдХрд┐рд▓реНрд▓рд╛ рдирд╛рдЧрдкреВрд░ рдЬрд┐рд▓реНрд╣реНрдпрд╛рддреАрд▓ рдирд░рдЦреЗрдб рддрд╛рд▓реБрдХреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЕрд╕рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ 'рдореЛрд╣рджреА' рдпрд╛ рдЧрд╛рд╡рд╛рдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рд╕реБрдорд╛рд░реЗ рдЖрда-рджрд╣рд╛ рдХрд┐рд▓реЛрдореАрдЯрд░ рдЕрдВрддрд░рд╛рд╡рд░ рд╡рд╕рд▓реЗрд▓рд╛ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рд╣рд╛ рдПрдХ рдкреМрд░рд╛рдгрд┐рдХ рдХрд┐рд▓реНрд▓рд╛ рдЕрд╕реВрди рдпреЗрдереАрд▓ рдирд┐рд╕рд░реНрдЧрд╕реМрдВрджрд░реНрдп рдЕрддрд┐рд╢рдп рдкреНрд░реЗрдХреНрд╖рдгреАрдп рдЖрд╣реЗ. рд╢рд╛рд│рд╛рдВрдЪреА рд╕рд╣рд▓ рдЬреЗрд╡реНрд╣рд╛ рдпреЗрдереЗ рдпреЗрддреЗ, рддреЗрд╡реНрд╣рд╛ рд╡рд┐рджреНрдпрд╛рд░реНрдереА рдХрд┐рд▓реНрд▓реНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдкрд░рд┐рд╕рд░, рддрд┐рдерд▓реА рдЭрд╛рдбреЗрдЭреБрдбрдкреЗ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдРрддрд┐рд╣рд╛рд╕рд┐рдХ рдорд╣рддреНрддреНрд╡ рдЬрд╛рдгреВрди рдШреЗрддрд╛рдд. рдпрд╛рдЪ рдкрд░рд┐рд╕рд░рд╛рдд рд╕рд╣рд▓ рдкрд░рддрдд рдЕрд╕рддрд╛рдирд╛ рд╡рдгрд╡рд╛ рд▓рд╛рдЧрд▓реНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рдШрдЯрдирд╛ рдШрдбрд▓реА.

longAnswers.modelAnswer: рдЬрд░ рдЖрдЧ рд╡реЗрд│реЗрд╡рд░ рд╡рд┐рдЭрд▓реА рдирд╕рддреА, рддрд░ рддреА рд╕рдВрдкреВрд░реНрдг рдЬрдВрдЧрд▓рд╛рдд рдкрд╕рд░рд▓реА рдЕрд╕рддреА рдЖрдгрд┐ рдореЛрдареНрдпрд╛ рдкреНрд░рдорд╛рдгрд╛рд╡рд░ рдирд┐рд╕рд░реНрдЧрд╛рдЪреА рд╣рд╛рдиреА рдЭрд╛рд▓реА рдЕрд╕рддреА. рдЬрдВрдЧрд▓рд╛рддреАрд▓ рдЕрдиреЗрдХ рдореМрд▓реНрдпрд╡рд╛рди рдЭрд╛рдбреЗ, рд╡рдирд╕реНрдкрддреА рдЬрд│реВрди рдЦрд╛рдХ рдЭрд╛рд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдЕрд╕рддреНрдпрд╛. рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рдорд╣рддреНрддреНрд╡рд╛рдЪреЗ рдореНрд╣рдгрдЬреЗ, рддрд┐рдереЗ рдЪрд░рдд рдЕрд╕рд▓реЗрд▓реЗ рдкрд╢реВ, рдкрдХреНрд╖реА рдЖрдгрд┐ рдЧреБрд░рд╛рдЦреА рдореБрд▓реЗрд╣реА рддреНрдпрд╛ рдЖрдЧреАрдд рднрд╛рдЬреВрди рдореГрддреНрдпреБрдореБрдЦреА рдкрдбрд▓реА рдЕрд╕рддреА. рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рддрддреНрдкрд░рддреЗрдореБрд│реЗ рд╣реЗ рд╕рд░реНрд╡ рдореЛрдареЗ рдЕрдирд░реНрде рдЯрд│рд▓реЗ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдЕрдиреЗрдХрд╛рдВрдЪреЗ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдг рд╡рд╛рдЪрд▓реЗ.

longAnswers.modelAnswer: рдорд▓рд╛ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреА 'рдкреНрд░рд╕рдВрдЧрд╛рд╡рдзрд╛рдирддрд╛' рдЖрдгрд┐ 'рдкрд░реЛрдкрдХрд╛рд░реА рд╡реГрддреНрддреА' рд╣реЗ рдЧреБрдг рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рдЬрд╛рд╕реНрдд рдЖрд╡рдбрд▓реЗ. рдЬреЗрд╡реНрд╣рд╛ рд╢рд┐рдХреНрд╖рдХ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдЗрддрд░ рдореЛрдареЗ рд▓реЛрдХ рдЖрдЧ рд╡рд┐рдЭрд╡рдгреЗ рдЕрд╢рдХреНрдп рдорд╛рдирдд рд╣реЛрддреЗ, рддреЗрд╡реНрд╣рд╛ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдиреЗ рд╣рд╛рд░ рди рдорд╛рдирддрд╛ рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпрдХреНрд╖ рдХреГрддреА рдХреЗрд▓реА. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреЗ "рдорд╛рдгрд╕рдВ рдЕрд╕реЛ рдХрд╛ рдЬрдирд╛рд╡рд░рдВ рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╡рд▓рдВрдЪ рдкрд╛рд╣рд┐рдЬреЗ" рд╣реЗ рд╡рд┐рдЪрд╛рд░ рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрд╡реЗрджрдирд╢реАрд▓ рдордирд╛рдЪреЗ рджрд░реНрд╢рди рдШрдбрд╡рддрд╛рдд. рд╕реНрд╡рддрдГрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгрд╛рдЪреА рдкрд░реНрд╡рд╛ рди рдХрд░рддрд╛ рдЗрддрд░рд╛рдВрд╕рд╛рдареА рдзрд╛рд╡реВрди рдЬрд╛рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рд╡реГрддреНрддреА рдЦрд░реЛрдЦрд░рдЪ рдХреМрддреБрдХрд╛рд╕реНрдкрдж рдЖрдгрд┐ рдкреНрд░реЗрд░рдгрд╛рджрд╛рдпреА рдЖрд╣реЗ.

longAnswers.question: рдпрд╛ рдкрд╛рдард╛рддреВрди рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдХреЛрдгрддреА рдореБрдЦреНрдп рд╢рд┐рдХрд╡рдг рдорд┐рд│рддреЗ?
longAnswers.modelAnswer: 'рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдЪреЗ рд╢реМрд░реНрдп' рдпрд╛ рдкрд╛рдард╛рддреВрди рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдзреИрд░реНрдпрд╛рдиреЗ рд╕рдВрдХрдЯрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреА рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╕рд╛рдорд╛рдЬрд┐рдХ рдЬрдмрд╛рдмрджрд╛рд░реАрдЪреА рд╢рд┐рдХрд╡рдг рдорд┐рд│рддреЗ. рд╕рдВрдХрдЯрдХрд╛рд│реА рдШрд╛рдмрд░реВрди рди рдЬрд╛рддрд╛ рдЙрдкрд▓рдмреНрдз рд╕рд╛рдзрдирд╛рдВрдЪрд╛ рд╡рд╛рдкрд░ рдХрд░реВрди рдорд╛рд░реНрдЧ рдХрд╕рд╛ рдХрд╛рдврд╛рд╡рд╛, рд╣реЗ рдЧреЛрдкрд╛рд│рдиреЗ рд╢рд┐рдХрд╡рд▓реЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рддрд╕реЗрдЪ, рдирд┐рд╕рд░реНрдЧ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдгреАрдорд╛рддреНрд░рд╛рдВрд╡рд░реАрд▓ рдкреНрд░реЗрдо рд╣реЗ рдХреЗрд╡рд│ рд╢рдмреНрджрд╛рдд рдирд╕реВрди рдХреГрддреАрдд рдЕрд╕рд╛рдпрд▓рд╛ рд╣рд╡реЗ, рд╣рд╛ рд╕рдВрджреЗрд╢ рдпрд╛рддреВрди рдорд┐рд│рддреЛ. рдПрдХ рдЬрд╛рдЧрд░реВрдХ рдирд╛рдЧрд░рд┐рдХ рдореНрд╣рдгреВрди рд╕рдВрдХрдЯрд╛рдд рд╕рд╛рдкрдбрд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛рдВрдирд╛ рдорджрдд рдХрд░рдгреЗ рд╣реЗ рдЖрдкрд▓реЗ рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдп рдЖрд╣реЗ, рд╣реЗ рдпрд╛ рдкрд╛рдард╛рдЪреЗ рд╕рд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ.
